oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery interviews Restless Heart Parts 1, 2 and 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Restless Heart (performance group) for the Ralph Emery Show. Tape labeled parts 1, 2 and 3. Recording is from April 24, 1987.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Restless Heart
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:04) Ralph Emery introduces Restless Heart members: Larry Stewart, Paul Gregg, John Dittrich, and Greg Jennings -- (00:41) Stewart reveals the early tracks that formed Restless Hearts Career; additionally, Restless Heart discuss their songs that had reached the top of the charts -- (02:36) Emery inquires about a song's video potential, and Emery and Restless Heart discuss the underlining factors of music videos -- (04:57) Dittrich discusses the importance of music videos to new acts receiving recognition while recalling a story about a gas station -- (06:28) Emery questions the band as to why they chose the name Restless Heart -- (09:26) Emery reveals that, when he first heard of Restless Heart, all of the members of Restless Heart were former session players -- (10:36) Stewart and Emery joke about the singing aspect of Restless Heart, and Emery inquires as to how the group came to be -- (16:12) Emery inquires about Stewart's father's musical career -- (17:06) Emery and Restless Heart discuss their upcoming tour year schedule -- (18:32) Emery praises Alabama's influence, and Emery and Dittrich discuss Alabama -- (20:24) Emery questions the Restless Heart members if they had difficulty getting their first record played -- (22:57) Emery inquires about the Restless Heart members' marital status -- (24:34) Emery inquires about the adjustment period when it comes to living together -- (25:57) Emery asks the Restless Heart members whether or not Restless Heart is a corporation -- (29:51) Emery and Gregg discuss a story about a packed club Restless Heart played at -- (31:51) Stewart and Dittrich are asked to discuss road stories, and Dittrich tells about how Gregg was left behind -- (36:28) Emery and Restless Heart discuss their family's response to their road life -- (37:18) Emery reintroduces the idea of Restless Heart discussing their upcoming year -- (38:33) Emery and Restless Heart discuss the recording needed for "Heartbreak Kid" and "Why Does it Have to be Wrong or Right" -- (40:29) Emery expresses his thanks, and Emery and the members of Restless Heart say goodbye
